comments.body: I think cats should have armor in minecraft I get sad when my cat dies in minecraft! MINECRAFT ADD CAT ARMOR
I would love it if cat armour protected my cats from Creeper explosions and Skeleton arrows!

There are already ways to do this... in Java you can make mobs silent and have no ai, and I'm sure there's some way to pull it off in bedrock without the animal noises being heard. Completely useless feature.

With splash potions, I can only make a mob invisible for so many minutes, but there is no way to silence one without the use of cheats.

This would be a very welcome change from trapping chickens in the ground just to make some ropes look good...
I think this idea is not too bad. A dance floor would be pretty good.
Vote for other Colorful light feedbacks.
Yea this idea rocks!

Honestly dripstone should be renamed to limestone and more variants of it added.
It should be partially transparent, slow boats but be possible to traverse.

It should also be intangible so that you can move through it, kind of like how paintings, and vines work, so while it is on top of the water, it doesn't block you from surfacing, or diving into the water, and adds to the atmosphere of the wetlands.
Breaks under boats so as to seem as if it’s parting, and spread like vines in all directions
Useful and educational!
Betta fish
Yes please!

A separate block could work, I have seen other suggestions to take this sort of block and tie it to enchanting. That way building up the enchanting table is based on filling the shelves with enchanted books (the level giving back to enchanting), which I do like mechanically as it would even make junk/cursed books useful. I have seen a Mod/data pack that does bookshelves aesthetically as you describe, and it does look good, so it is doable for sure.  To be consistent this new block would probably need just 6 planks, 2 rows of 3 with a space in between. Making it a cheaper option, and with storage of a barrel would be epic, with the exclusive of holding: maps, compass and timer, books, signed books, paper, enchanted books, and lapis, which just represents what would show up randomly on the texture in stacks as the shelves filled. Only enchanted books would count towards an enchanting effect, but the others could make it easier for builders to quickly fill as desired for looks.

If current bookshelves would be modified so that you can put books in them and take books out of them, maybe get a redstone signal out, then bookshelves would become cheaper to make.

You would only need to make a empty bookshelf and you can fill it up later we you have the resources.

Maybe enchanting could be effected by the number of books inside.

Maybe you would get treasure enchantments and a new enchantment called:
Firestride- makes you move faster in lava.
It should be added I think
oh, yeah it should be added
This is a great idea. (This is almost like snipers but ok)

Minecraft is set in medieval times and this type of transport was not used in those times

And who said it was in medieval time I mean I never heard mojang talk about that is that what you think it set on cuz I really don’t care what time it’s on I just would like to have a way of more creative fun something new an different to Minecraft it’s self every ones going by mojangs rules but who said we can’t break them who said we could not live with these thing so tell me who said there’s no need for these items

416644720772 I never said that minecraft occur in medieval times, I said that it is set in medieval times, also cars use electricity and in Minecraft there is no electricity, the red stone is radiation.

I do think cars fit that it’s called stem pump I mean think plus there is really no magic if there really was wouldn’t wand be a thing

Maybe a firework rocket engine could be implemented? You fill the rocket engine with fireworks and that moves the structure forward. Good idea?
And furnace boats, command block boats, hopper boats, barrel boats, tnt boats, and whatnot.

This would offer a cool way to customize boats I like it. This feature would give me incentive to name my boat and find a cool shulker color and wood combination. I love it when Minecraft let's you make personalized items so this would be great.

1.19's boats with chest are great, until you hit land. Then it's no longer extra inventory space. Being able to combine a shulker with a boat as a future upgrade with one that maintains its storage (just like a regular shulker) would make it easier to adventure across the world with extra inventory space.
And make us able to name them and have them keep the name, have them show like any other entity. Please!

Stackable potions up to 8 would be good but i think 16 might be too good, cause thats 432 in 1 shulker box

 

and the pocket potions is a great idea but you shouldn't be able to stack the potions in the slot.

16 seems too high. I think 4 would be GREAT already because rn they're pretty impractical to use.

If you could carry 4 of each type it would make sense to use them occasionally eg cave adventures. Speed potions, jump boost, feather falling, damage, night vision etc would all make sense here.

Cluttering your inventory with those is pretty much impossible and carrying them in a shulker box doesnt allow you to use them flexible enough for it to make sense.

Stacking them to 4 or allowing up to 4 potions inside of a bundle would in my opinion make them a super viable option for many scenarios.

potions as they are aren't usable, for most tasks, water breathing and fire resistance are ok without stacking but things like speed, strength, slow falling, or offensive splash potions of all kinds are mostly disabled by the inability to stack them
we need this it would be the most useful sorter possible and though it could be more resource costly sorters likely wouldn't lag worlds all the time
That is something I've wanted for soo long

Just download a mod if you want these “un-minecrafty” things... Only a few people would want this kind of item, don’t mean to be rude but it wouldn’t fit in the game!

It will temporary give u a enchantment on your armor allows you to shock or light up mobs that hits the player or that player hits..  I as well think it shouldn't be as easy to craft this armor.. I think it should be made of copper blocks instead ingots and and already a special in game item like maybe the nether star to craft it.. I think tools shouldn't be added only the armor...

This was added to the game a few weeks after this was posted in the snapshot that added axolotls.

There's a much simpler way to go about a crafting recipe.  Just put an item frame or glow item frame on a crafting table with a netherwart, a golden carrot, and a fermented spider eye: the brewing ingredients for an invisibility potion.  Then to stop it from being easily lost, make it so that its only invisible when there's an item in the frame.

I think a good way to craft them without it being too hard or easy to get could be having the crafting recipe the same as the normal item frame, but with a glass pane or something similar swapped out for the leather. i feel like this would be cheap enough in bulk but wouldn't be too expensive for what it is.
I quite like the idea of an exclusive underwater building material.
I was going to post this to feedback but then I saw your post

I really really would love to be able to build normally with coral blocks and I think a system similar to copper waxing is an excellent way to do it! Maybe if not wax, perhaps slime? I was gonna start building a really cool house idea and was disappointed when I found out that no matter what I did the coral blocks would die. :[

I love the coral textures and how bright the colors are and really wish we could use it outside of water normally, I think it would open up so many more options and creative build ideas for the game.
